title: AnnexRepo.copy_to() performs invalid isdir() test on relative path
body:
I was hoping I could sync the content within a subdataset's subdirectory by providing it as a path to publish, but instead I see this failure (full output and script are attached):

```
$ datalad publish -r --to smaug subds/subdir
[INFO   ] Publishing <Dataset path=/tmp/tmp.YRvDfHokdq-publish-dir/subds> data to smaug
FileNotInAnnexError: command 'git annex lookupkey subdir'
File not in annex: subdir
[Errno None] git annex lookupkey subdir: File not in annex: subdir: 'subdir'
```

If subdir is a subdirectory of the top-level repo, the data within that subdirectory is published as expected.

<details>
<summary>script</summary>

Assumes host with name "smaug":

```sh
#!/bin/sh

set -eux

datalad --version

cd $(mktemp -d --suffix=-publish-dir)
datalad create
datalad create -d. subds
mkdir subds/subdir
datalad run "echo foo >subds/subdir/foo"

DSID=$(git config --file=.datalad/config datalad.dataset.id)
datalad create-sibling -s smaug -r "smaug:/tmp/$DSID"

datalad publish -r --to smaug subds/subdir
```
